item.title: Example Talk
item.description:
Click on the Slides button above to view the built-in slides feature.

Slides can be added in a few ways:

  • Create slides using Wowchemy’s Slides feature and link using slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file
  • Upload an existing slide deck to static/ and link using url_slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file
  • Embed your slides (e.g. Google Slides) or presentation video on this page using shortcodes.

Further event details, including page elements such as image galleries, can be added to the body of this page.

item.title: Interview with TU Bergakademie Freiberg
item.description:
Q&A withâ€¦ …Philip Duah, Master student (Sustainable Mining and Remediation Management) from Ghana and DAAD award winner.

Why did you decide to study at TUBAF?

My goal was to attend a top mining university that places great emphasis on internationalization, is known for mining research and innovation, and where I can study and conduct research at the intersection of mining, technology, and sustainability. I found out about TUBAF during my search and was immediately convinced.

You won the DAAD award. How are you involved with international students?

I have been part of the buddy program for new international students since my 2nd semester. I co-founded the Amnesty International university group and was its spokesperson. I also served on a committee of the Student Council (StuRa) and I helped organize the Festival of Cultures. Currently, I offer online consultations for students in my degree program as a tutor.

What opportunities are there to get involved at the university?

Within the university, we are always looking for committed students to support the committee work in the StuRa and the FSRs. It is also possible to participate in the buddy program to support new international students. Additionally, there are working groups, clubs and initiatives within the university that are always looking for new members. Getting involved in these areas is a form of personal development and is very rewarding.

What tip do you have for international students?

Don’t be afraid to ask questions. There is a lot of support here. You can always contact the International University Center. Without its support, for example, I would not have been able to complete my second internship. The Career Center also supports international students and already invited us to a meeting to better understand our career needs and to work out new strategies. For me, TUBAF is a cosmopolitan place where international exchange and diversity of opinions are always in the first place, both in research and teaching.

Press Release

Facebook:

Interview as reported on the Facebook page of TU Bergakademie Freiberg

Instagram:

Interview as reported on the Instagram page of TU Bergakademie Freiberg

item.title: DAAD Prize for Outstanding Achievements by International Students at German Universities.
item.description:
On the 18th of October, 2022 I was awarded the 2022 DAAD Prize at TU Bergakademie Freiberg.

The German Academic Exchange Service (DAAD) via German Universities, every year, awards the DAAD Prize for outstanding achievements by international Students at German Universities. This prize is given to International Students who complete their studies at German Universities and who stand out for both their academic prowess and their exceptional social or intercultural engagement.The University is in charge of selecting the recipient of the prize. The final decision-making authority is the Rectorate of the University.

I thank the DAAD, TU Bergakademie Freiberg and the German Foreign Office for the honor and recognizing my contribution to the German Society.

Press Release

The award ceremony as reported on the website of TU Bergakademie Freiberg

More on DAAD Prize can be found here

item.title: Prediction of Rock Fragmentation using a Novel Hybrid Evolutionary Algorithm and Extreme Gradient Boosting Machine
Exchange With The Rector of TU Bergakademie Freiberg
item.description:
On August 28th, an official meeting was held with Prof. Dr. Klaus-Dieter Barbknecht, the Rector of TU Bergakademie Freiberg who also serves as chairman of the State Rectors’ Conference of Saxony, Germany. Participants included the director of the University Graduate and Research Academy, Dr. Kristina Wopat, as well as student council members (StuRa), the Feminism Group, and the International Center’s working group for foreign students (AKAS).

In my brief presentation, I detailed my ambitions for Freiberg and the University. As the Founder, Spokesperson, and President of Amnesty International Freiberg, a human rights group comprising over forty students from 13 different countries studying and living in Freiberg, I mentioned that the university authorities must show their full solidarity at all times for minority students.

The rise of hate groups and right-wing extremists in Freiberg and the state (Saxony) in general warrants a safe space for people with migration backgrounds, refugees, Black people, and other minorities studying in the University. Taking a pragmatic approach to dealing with societal acceptance of minority students within the city will not be easy; however, in order to overcome societal challenges, collaboration, solidarity, and common ideas will be necessary.

In his remarks, the rector expressed his strong commitment to ensuring the well-being of international students. He stressed how important it is to him that students in Freiberg live in safety. A number of his encouraging pieces of advice focused on what to do if a student falls victim to abuse or attack within the city. We concluded the meeting by discussing the possibility of holding a student parliament. The purpose of this special event is to engage Germans and international students at the TU Bergakademie Freiberg in human rights discussions while fostering civil society engagement.

Press Release

The meeting was featured in the press release of TU Bergakademie Freiberg

item.title: Unraveling the Capability of Artificial Intelligence for Prediction of Rock Fragmentation
Slides
item.description:
Create slides in Markdown with Wowchemy

Wowchemy | Documentation

Features

  • Efficiently write slides in Markdown
  • 3-in-1: Create, Present, and Publish your slides
  • Supports speaker notes
  • Mobile friendly slides

Controls

  • Next: Right Arrow or Space
  • Previous: Left Arrow
  • Start: Home
  • Finish: End
  • Overview: Esc
  • Speaker notes: S
  • Fullscreen: F
  • Zoom: Alt + Click
  • PDF Export: E

Code Highlighting

Inline code: variable

Code block:

porridge = "blueberry"
if porridge == "blueberry":
    print("Eating...")

Math

In-line math: $x + y = z$

Block math:

$$ f\left( x \right) = ;\frac{{2\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x - 4} \right)}}{{\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x + 1} \right)}} $$

Fragments

Make content appear incrementally

{{% fragment %}} One {{% /fragment %}}
{{% fragment %}} **Two** {{% /fragment %}}
{{% fragment %}} Three {{% /fragment %}}

Press Space to play!

One **Two** Three

A fragment can accept two optional parameters:

  • class: use a custom style (requires definition in custom CSS)
  • weight: sets the order in which a fragment appears

Speaker Notes

Add speaker notes to your presentation

{{% speaker_note %}}
- Only the speaker can read these notes
- Press `S` key to view
{{% /speaker_note %}}

Press the S key to view the speaker notes!

  • Only the speaker can read these notes
  • Press S key to view

Themes

  • black: Black background, white text, blue links (default)
  • white: White background, black text, blue links
  • league: Gray background, white text, blue links
  • beige: Beige background, dark text, brown links
  • sky: Blue background, thin dark text, blue links
  • night: Black background, thick white text, orange links
  • serif: Cappuccino background, gray text, brown links
  • simple: White background, black text, blue links
  • solarized: Cream-colored background, dark green text, blue links

Custom Slide

Customize the slide style and background

{{< slide background-image="/media/boards.jpg" >}}
{{< slide background-color="#0000FF" >}}
{{< slide class="my-style" >}}

Custom CSS Example

Let’s make headers navy colored.

Create assets/css/reveal_custom.css with:

.reveal section h1,
.reveal section h2,
.reveal section h3 {
  color: navy;
}

Questions?

Ask

Documentation
